Module roborally
Package client.model

Class Client

java.lang.Object
client.model.Client
Direct Known Subclasses:
AIClient, ViewClient
public abstract class Client
extends java.lang.Object
The Client class is abstract and represents a generalisation of the ViewClient and AIClient. It stores the number of damage cards and how to handle them. It also takes care of disconnecting a client and individual naming.
Author:
sarah

    The port of the server on the named host is saved here for the socket creation.

    The ReaderThread that reads (for the client) the servers input constantly and prints it out on the console.

    Stream socket which get connected to the specified port number on the named host of the server.
    protected int thisPlayersID
    The playerID of the client.
    private java.io.PrintWriter writer
    The PrintWriter which writes messages onto the socket connected to the server.

  • Method Details

    • handleDamageCount

      public void handleDamageCount​(java.util.ArrayList<CardType> cardList)
      This method reduces the number of damage cards on the associated deck.
      Parameters:
      cardList - received damage cards

    • handleDamageCount

      public void handleDamageCount​(CardType cardType)
      This method reduces the number of damage cards on the associated deck.
      Parameters:
      cardType - received damage CardType

    • handleMessage

      protected abstract void handleMessage​(JSONMessage message)
      This abstract method should be implemented to handle JSONMessages.
      Parameters:
      message - JSONMessage that should get handled

    • establishConnection

      public boolean establishConnection()
      This method establishes the connection between the server and the client using the assigned hostname and port. If this was successful it creates a ReaderThread and a WriterThread which handle the communication onwards.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(JSONBody jsonBody)
      Sends a JSONMessage to the server. The JSONMessage is serialized therefore.
      Parameters:
      jsonBody - Body of the JSONMessage which should be sent.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      This method ends the client program. The reader and writer threads get interrupted and the socket is closed.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect​(java.lang.Exception ex)
      This method should be called if a critical exception occurs in the client. (e.g. socket closed) The reader and writer threads get interrupted and the socket is closed.
      Parameters:
      ex - The exception which occurred

    • getPlayerFromID

      public Player getPlayerFromID​(int id)
      Gets a player based on their ID from the list of players saved in ViewClient.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the wanted player.
      Returns:
      Unique player with the ID, null if no player with the ID exists.

    • getUniqueName

      public java.lang.String getUniqueName​(int id)
      Obtains a unique name of the player.

      If player.getName() is not unique, the id is appended to the name.

      e.g. 'Alice' or 'Alice #3' could be the returned name.

      Parameters:
      id - ID of the player from whom a unique name should be obtained.
      Returns:
      unique name of the player.
